output.conclusion: This course provided a foundational understanding of cloud computing concepts, service models, deployment models, and key technologies. Further exploration and hands-on experience are recommended to deepen your expertise.
output.introduction: Welcome to Cloud Computing Basics! This course will provide you with a solid understanding of the fundamental concepts and technologies behind cloud computing. We will explore different service models, deployment models, and key considerations for adopting cloud solutions.

chapters.description: What is cloud computing? Defining characteristics, benefits, and limitations. On-demand self-service, broad network access, resource pooling, rapid elasticity, measured service.
A brief overview of the history of cloud computing, from early concepts to modern platforms. Key milestones and driving forces behind its growth.
Virtualization, containers, serverless computing, microservices, and other core technologies that enable cloud services.
Overview of IaaS: virtual machines, storage, networks. Use cases and examples of IaaS providers.
Overview of PaaS: application development platforms, middleware, databases. Use cases and examples of PaaS providers.
Overview of SaaS: ready-to-use applications, CRM, email, office suites. Use cases and examples of SaaS providers.
Characteristics of public clouds: shared infrastructure, pay-as-you-go pricing. Examples of public cloud providers.
Characteristics of private clouds: dedicated infrastructure, enhanced security. Use cases for private clouds.
Combining public and private clouds: benefits and challenges. Use cases for hybrid cloud deployments.
Security challenges in the cloud: data breaches, compliance, access control. Best practices for securing cloud environments.
Strategies for optimizing cloud spending: resource utilization, cost monitoring, reserved instances.
Establishing policies and procedures for managing cloud resources. Compliance requirements and frameworks.
